title.value: Imagining a Future of Designing with AI: Dynamic Grounding, Constructive Negotiation, and Sustainable Motivation
title.justification: This is the exact title of the paper as mentioned in the given text.
title.quote: Imagining a Future of Designing with AI: Dynamic Grounding, Constructive Negotiation, and Sustainable Motivation

extractions.description: The paper ideates a future design workflow involving AI technology, exploring the unique affordances of large AI models, particularly language models, in design processes. It envisions a future where AI contributes significantly through dynamic grounding, constructive negotiation, and sustainable motivation, using the design fiction of 'Squirrel Game' as a prototype to illustrate these concepts.

type.justification: The paper is primarily focused on conceptualizing future design workflows with AI, theoretical affordances, and speculative design fiction rather than empirical experiments or data.
type.quote: Our goal was to refrain from our tendency as HCI systems researchers to jump into implementation... Thus, our contribution is chiefly conceptual.

name.justification: The paper discusses the impact of AI on human-computer interaction and explores theoretical frameworks around it.
name.quote: The advent of AI deep learning techniques and foundation models (commonly referred to as large language models or LLMs) marks a paradigm shift in human-computer interaction (HCI) research.

name.justification: The paper discusses the use of natural language models and their novel affordances in design processes.
name.quote: We isolated AIâ€™s potential for dynamic grounding, constructive negotiation, and sustainable motivation as three key affordances. All three relate to the fact that foundation models (a) embed a wide degree of cultural and social context outside of a specific domain, (b) can apply this understanding to augment outputs within a context.

name.justification: The paper mentions GPT-4-vision as an example of a foundation model used in human-computer interactions and designing tools for design processes.
name.quote: Chatting with foundation models like GPT-4-vision, for instance, people can now submit whiteboard drawings to generate code for open-domain tasks, interactions that previously required custom models and substantial feature engineering.
